Class SimpleWaveManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleWaveManager
  • public class SimpleWaveManager
extends java.lang.Object
    SimpleWaveManager

    Library for reading and writing WAVE audio files.

    Designed to allow audio input/output code to be portable across different platforms (Windows, Android, Linux, etc.) and Java versions (Java 6 and higher). Targets systems without access to JavaX Sound or Android Media libraries. Does not support audio playback and must use playback features offered by JavaX or Android. Supports mono and stereo file input/output.

    Author:
    Abir Haque

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes​(java.io.File file)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads bytes within audio file. Header is included.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Byte array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMonoValues

        public static java.lang.Double[] getMonoValues​(java.io.File file)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads bytes within mono audio file, strips header, and converts remnant bytes into double sound values ranging from -1 to 1.
        Parameters:
        file - File to read.
        Returns:
        Double array of sound values. Null if bits per sample is not 8 or 16.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getStereoValues

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double[]> getStereoValues​(java.io.File file)
                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads bytes within stereo audio file, strips header, and converts remnant bytes into double sound values ranging from -1 to 1. Bytes are split into their respective channels, which is left or right.
        Parameters:
        file - File to read.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of two double arrays of sound values, where Double array at index 0 represents the left channel, and double array at index 1 represents the right channel. Null if bits per sample is not 8 or 16.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Double[] values,
                         java.lang.String fileName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes bytes into mono audio file with default sample rate of 44100 hertz and bits per sample of 16 bits.
        Parameters:
        values - Double values to convert, then write.
        fileName - Name of output file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Double[] values,
                         int sampleRate,
                         int bitsPerSample,
                         java.lang.String fileName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes bytes into mono audio file with custom sample rate and bits per sample.
        Parameters:
        values - Double values to convert, then write.
        sampleRate - Sample rate.
        bitsPerSample - Bits per sample. Can only output 8-bit or 16-bit audio.
        fileName - Name of output file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Double[] channel1Values,
                         java.lang.Double[] channel2Values,
                         java.lang.String fileName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes bytes into stereo audio file with default sample rate of 44100 hertz and bits per sample of 16 bits.
        Parameters:
        channel1Values - Double values to convert, then write into left channel.
        channel2Values - Double values to convert, then write into right channel.
        fileName - Name of output file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Double[] channel1Values,
                         java.lang.Double[] channel2Values,
                         int sampleRate,
                         int bitsPerSample,
                         java.lang.String fileName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes bytes into stereo audio file with custom sample rate and bits per sample.
        Parameters:
        channel1Values - Double values to convert, then write into left channel.
        channel2Values - Double values to convert, then write into right channel.
        sampleRate - Sample rate.
        bitsPerSample - Bits per sample. Can only output 8-bit or 16-bit audio.
        fileName - Name of output file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Unit test writing and printing mono audio file values, and writing two identical mono audio files using different write methods and two identical stereo audio files using different write methods.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
